column1: Full name Susan Grimshaw.Female.Susan was one of the oldest members of Dutch's Gang
column2: who was rumoured to have known Dutch van der Linde for years. It was rumoured by many members that she and Dutch might have had a secret relationship. She had always remain a close associate and follower of Dutch
column3: gaining his respect and eventually became the gang's arbiter. Susan Grimshaw is cleaning the table.

column1: Male. Dutch's childhood was an unhappy one. Dutch's father was conscripted into the Union Army during the American Civil War and was killed during an unnamed battle.Dutch quickly found living the life of a petty criminal. While still a young man
column2: he ran into a con artist named Hosea Matthews on the road. Hosea and Dutch eventually met 14-year old orphan Arthur Morgan
column3: who Dutch decided to take under his wing. Around this time
column4: Dutch also began a romantic relationship with Susan Grimshaw
column5: who also joined the gang. Their relationship would end
column7: when Dutch fell in love with a woman named Annabelle. She was eventually murdered. Dutch is smoking his pipe under a tent.

column1: Male. Full name Micah Bell. Dutch tried to sell gold that his gang had recently stolen
column3: leading to an altercation where Micah stepped in and saved his life.As a result
column4: Micah was accepted into the Van der Linde gang. Despite being an experienced outlaw who was respected for his skill in combat
column5: Micah was generally disliked within the gang; in particular
column6: Arthur and Hosea saw him as argumentative
column8: with Dutch alone taking a liking to him. Micah is leaning against a tree.

column1: Male. Hosea us an old Man. Hosea is an intelligent outlaw in touch with his wits
column2: having worked as a con-artist and a thief for over two decades. Unlike Arthur or Dutch
column3: Hosea prefers not to use violence as a means of obtaining money. Instead
column4: Hosea often resorts on elaborate schemes to swindle people out of their money
column5: playing a character to distract and disarm those he is trying to rob. However
column6: Hosea is willing to resort to violence when he feels that it is warranted.In the mid-1870s
column7: Hosea met another outlaw named Dutch van der Linde at a campfire; he tried to con and rob Dutch
column8: only to realize that Dutch had stolen from him in the meantime. Both saw the skill that the other had and laughed
column9: before deciding to team up together. Hosea is reading a book sitting on a wooden chair

column1: Fat male. Simon Pearson was born to a family of whale hunters
column2: and he initially wanted to follow in their footsteps. However the whaling industry had declined by the time he left school
column3: forcing him to pursue other careers. At some point prior to 1899
column5: and subsequently became the butcher and cook for Dutch van der Linde and his gang after they rescued him from loan sharks.Pearson is described as a loud and jolly degenerate
column6: who appears to be in denial about the turn his life has taken. He takes his position as the campâ€™s cook seriously
column7: and is always grateful when Arthur offers to go out hunting. Pearson is carrying sacks from one side of the camp to the other.

column1: The opening of the starting scene is preceded by a failed attempt to rob a ferry in Blackwater. The attempt was carried out under the advice of Micah Bell. Dutch killed an innocent woman named Heidi McCourt during the botched job. Hosea in particular found this disturbing
column2: though he had also become increasingly disillusioned with Dutch's leadership over the years. The Blackwater Massacre forced the Van der Linde gang to hide out in the mountains of Ambarino for the winter. They moved to a clearing out near a forest
column4: after robbing a train and set up camp there.
